1. Incorporate lean proteins: Instead of just fruits and vegetables, try adding lean proteins like chicken, fish, or tofu to your meals. This will help you meet your protein needs without consuming excessive calories.

2. Portion control: Even healthy foods can contribute to weight loss if consumed in large quantities. Practice portion control by using smaller plates and measuring your food.

3. Stay hydrated: Drinking water can help you feel full and prevent overeating. Aim for at least eight glasses of water per day.

4. Balanced meals: Make sure your meals include a variety of foods from all the food groups (fruits, vegetables, grains, protein, and dairy). This will ensure you're getting all the necessary nutrients.

5. Consult a healthcare professional: If you're unsure about your dietary needs or have any concerns, it's always best to consult a healthcare professional, such as a doctor or a registered dietitian.
